org.fosstrak.epcis.repository.query
Class Schedule

java.lang.Object
  org.fosstrak.epcis.repository.query.Schedule
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Schedule
extends Object
implements Serializable

This is a simple schedule which can return a "next scheduled time" after now or a given time. It is meant to be instantiated with a EPCIS QuerySchedule but could be extended to be used otherwise.

Author:
Arthur van Dorp, Marco Steybe
See Also:
Serialized Form

ImplementationExceptionResponse

nextScheduledTime

public GregorianCalendar nextScheduledTime(GregorianCalendar time)
                                    throws ImplementationExceptionResponse
Calculates the next scheduled time after the given time. Algorithm idea:
- start with biggest time unit (i.e. year) of the given time
- if the time unit is valid (e.g. the time unit matches the
scheduled time, this is implicitly true if the time in the
schedule was omitted) *and* there exists a valid smaller time
unit, *then* return this time unit
- do this recursively for all time units
- month needs to be special cased because of dayOfWeek

Parameters:
time - Time after which next scheduled time should be returned.
Returns:
The next scheduled time after 'time'.
Throws:
ImplementationException - Almost any kind of error.
ImplementationExceptionResponse
